<title level="1" right="Focus 4" pfs="Standard">[Glimpse the Truth](/Spells.aspx?ID=425)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Revelation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=138" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 393 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Domain**
[Truth](/Domains.aspx?ID=32)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Single Action" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 30-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

Divine insight lets you see things as they truly are. The GM attempts a secret counteract check against each illusion that is at least partially within the area. Instead of counteracting the illusion, you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against an [_illusory disguise_](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) spell, you see the creature's true form but _illusory disguise_ doesn't end).

 The area moves with you for the duration of the spell, and the GM attempts a secret counteract check each time a new illusion is within the area.

---
**Heightened (7th)** You can allow everyone to see through illusions you succeed against, not just yourself.
name: Glimpse the Truth
